text_highlighted: Running locker() routine for system locking.
Failed to lock directory /var/run: exit status 1

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Executes the "awk" command used to scan for patterns (typically in standard output)
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Executes the "kill" or "pkill" command typically used to terminate processes
Creates hidden files, links and/or directories
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Executes the "ps" command used to list the status of processes
Executes the "iptables" command used for managing IP filtering and manipulation
Reads the 'hosts' file potentially containing internal network hosts
Reads CPU information from /sys indicative of miner or evasive malware
Reads system information from the proc file system
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports

signature_matches.description: Executes the "kill" or "pkill" command typically used to terminate processes
Reads CPU information from /sys indicative of miner or evasive malware
Executes the "awk" command used to scan for patterns (typically in standard output)
Reads the 'hosts' file potentially containing internal network hosts
Connects to IPs without corresponding DNS lookups
Executes the "grep" command used to find patterns in files or piped streams
Reads system information from the proc file system
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Tries to connect to HTTP servers, but all servers are down (expired dropper behavior)
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports
Executes the "ps" command used to list the status of processes
All domains contacted by the sample do not resolve. The sample is likely an old dropper which does no longer work.
ELF files written in Go
Sample deletes itself
Static ELF header machine description suggests that the sample might not execute correctly on this machine.
Performs DNS lookups
Protects files from modification
Tries to resolve domain names, but no domain seems valid (expired dropper behavior)
Classification label
All HTTP servers contacted by the sample do not answer. The sample is likely an old dropper which does no longer work.
Creates hidden files and/or directories
Sample has stripped symbol table
Executes the "iptables" command used for managing IP filtering and manipulation
May try to detect the virtual machine to hinder analysis (VM artifact strings found in memory)
Executes the "iptables" command to insert, remove and/or manipulate rules
Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Static ELF header machine description suggests that the sample might only run correctly on MIPS or ARM architectures.
